intro: Erigeron apurensis, commonly known as the Apure fleabane, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Venezuela and Colombia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils, and it is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its flowering period occurs during the dry season, and it produces small, white to pale blue flowers that attract various pollinators. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and potential medicinal properties.
